title.value: Invited Commentary on Stoehr J et al: The Personal Impact of Involvement in International Global Health Outreach: A National Survey of Former Operation Smile Student Volunteers
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Invited Commentary on Stoehr J et al: The Personal Impact of Involvement in International Global Health Outreach: A National Survey of Former Operation Smile Student Volunteers

extractions.description: This commentary evaluates the impact of international global health outreach on volunteers, specifically focusing on high school and college students involved in Operation Smile. It discusses the personal and professional benefits these volunteers gain and reflects on the broader implications for global surgical care.

type.justification: The paper seems to be a theoretical discussion on the impact of global health outreach based on previous studies, rather than presenting new empirical research.
type.quote: The study rightly concludes that student participation in global surgical volunteerism is very beneficial to both individuals and to our society as a whole.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the impact of volunteering in international global health missions, particularly in surgical contexts.
name.quote: The study rightly concludes that student participation in global surgical volunteerism is very beneficial to both individuals and to our society as a whole.

name.justification: The commentary discusses the impact of global health volunteerism on educational and career choices of volunteers.
name.quote: many of these young adult volunteers later completed graduate degrees and chose healthcare careers.

name.justification: The paper addresses ethical concerns regarding international surgical training programs and cross-cultural rotations.
name.quote: the potential of abusing for personal gain the hospitality offered by our colleagues in under-resourced countries must always be carefully considered.
